result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Michael Johnson

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Eric Michael Johnson.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen notes that a competency issue has been raised. Notes that there was an attempt for an assessment but there was a problem with scheduling the assessment. Defers to the court. Court notes matter was set out a few months to allow for assessment. Attorney Nelsen notes that there was an effort made but the assessment has not been completed. State would be agreeable to more time if it would allow for the assessment. State notes that the defendant's mother wants him taken into custody. Court asks the significance of that message. State is unsure.
Attorney Nelsen asks for 45 days, notes that it is difficult to get scheduled. Has been able to contact defendant's family but has been unable to get in contact with the defendant. Believes the assessment can be done in outpatient. Attorney Nelsen cannot advocate for inpatient basis. State will monitor with forensics unit and give input on how to proceed.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:39 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen appeared by video for Eric Michael Johnson.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf for Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State reviews report that defendant was not cooperative with outpatient evaluation. Attorney Nelsen has nothing further than what was in the letter. Court questions if defendant will cooperate with the evaluation. Court allows defendant one more chance to do outpatient evaluation. Defendant understands he could be taken into custody at next status if he does not comply with outpatient evaluation. Attorney Nelsen in agreement and reviews with defendant the process of complying with evaluation.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter to Court from WI Forensics Unit re: unable to contact defendant

11:35 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Eric Michael Johnson.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates was on competency order, did not cooperate with evaluation. Attorney Nelson spoke with unit. Defendant can't be contacted directly. Trying to get the evaluation scheduled. Court sets status.
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Letter to Judge Thimm from Deborah Collins with the Wisconsin Forensics Unit

11:24 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen appeared by video for Eric Michael Johnson.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney Nelson indicates discussed evaluation with client. Defendant was in agreement. Nelson filed motion for assessment. 
Court orders competency evaluation. Nelson will prepare order. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's motion for competency evaluation
Status conference on May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

11:32 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicates he did go to the Public Defender's office but can't afford it. Court questions Defendant. Defendant will go to the Public Defender's office. Atty Hoffman will give him an application. 
Court will set for Status.
Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:47 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State- Def. was given form to waive counsel, never filled out or returned.
Defendant- Can't afford attorney, wants one
Court- go to Public Defender today. Gives attorney options.
Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:58 AM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State notes no waiver of attorney form as been given. Defendant was expecting a plea and just started a new job. Defendant does not want attorney representation. Court takes break at 11:59 am for defendant to fill out waiver of attorney form. Court goes back on record and sets out status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Order Sealing ID Key
Amended ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
Text reminder opt in
No violent or abusive contact with victim #1

02:01 PM Defendant Eric Michael Johnson in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant ack. receipt of complaint and key; defendant verifies his address; pleads NG 
State requests 350.00 cash bail and no violent or abusive contact with victim 1; prior convictions stated on the record w/failures to appear
Defendant-no comment
Court-orders no violent or abusive contact with victim #1
Defendant-can not post cash bail today and request signature bond
Court-orders 1000.00 signature bond; no violent or abusive contact with victim #1  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
